definition: lit. the cycle comes back to the start (idiom); to move in circles/the wheel comes full circle
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
